i need help guys, the gnome is slow on my machine.. how can i install xfce ??
It's the first thing to try, and if it gives no other errors then it'll work.
Pastebin the error and give us a link; it's scrolled fairly far back.
Instead of "it says something like," could you paste the exact error?
i dont know how to copy paste in the terminal
Then type one character at a time. Or, if you used gnome-terminal from within X, you can highlight something and then middle-click to paste.
Did you make a separate partition for /boot?
Paste the output of "ls -lh /boot" to the pastebin.
Basically, when you past that output we'll be able to see how many old kernel versions you have, and then you can uninstall a few.
Sorry, I should have said to do that with sudo.
OK, you're going to have to do things the hard way.
Do the following after someone other than me says it's a good idea: sudo rm both of the files ending in .bak, and then try sudo dpkg --reconfigure -a again.
